subject: Re: Could not start test case: java.lang.ClassCastException: org.apache.xerces.parse
msgSnippet: Scott: I have changed the excluded.properties in junit.jar before i run the junit test. Here is the content in the file: excluded.0=sun.* excluded.1=com.sun.*
messageBody:
Scott:

I have changed the excluded.properties in junit.jar before i run the
junit test. Here is the content in the file:


excluded.0=sun.*
excluded.1=com.sun.*
excluded.2=org.omg.*
excluded.3=javax.*
excluded.4=sunw.*
excluded.5=java.*
excluded.6=org.w3c.dom.*
excluded.7=org.xml.sax.*
excluded.8=net.jini.*

Weel, I still got the error as I described in the previous post. Any
ideas?

--- In junit@y..., "Scott Stirling" <scottstirling@r...> wrote:
> The answer to this is in the JUnit FAQ.
>
> http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm#runners_1
>
> Scott Stirling
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: xinhong_luo [mailto:xinhong.luo@f...]
> > Sent: Wednesday, July 31, 2002 4:47 PM
> > To: junit@y...
> > Subject: [junit] Could not start test case:
> > java.lang.ClassCastException: org.apache.xerces.parse
> >
> >
> > Hi,
> > I am using junit (version 3.7, and apache's xerces xml parser) to
do
> > unit test for my class which is a xml parser with dom. I can run
the
> > program through the main method with the class, but it fail if I
run
> > from junit test. the message is:
> >
> > Could not start test case: java.lang.ClassCastException:
> > org.apache.xerces.parsers.StandardParserConfiguration
> >
> > at the line:
> > DOMParser parser = new DOMParser();
> >
> >
> > Please help.
